name: Protea Hotel Franschhoek

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here hoping to have a romantic break without kids at the end of a family holiday. The room was large and well equipped. The pool area was great with plenty of loungers. Breakfast was fine with friendly service. Hotel is on the main street in Franschoek so v well placed for exploring the town. We really enjoyed our stay here - would recommend.
reviews.title: Good central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights at the begining of January. The place is okay, but lacks the charm of so many other South African hotels and B&Bs. The staff were friendly and the breakfast was fine, but the overall impression is of a motel. There are much nicer places to stay in Franschhoek.
reviews.title: Okay not great especially by S.A. standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved Franschhoek and loved being able to walk into town. This ability to walk into town was so significant it made up for below to the extent we would probably stay here again ahead of the 5 star rated places.
reviews.title: Great location, noisy cicadas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most impersonal place we stayed in south africa, we got there early and hotel seemed empty but we had to wait until 2pm to check in (which is fair but every other place demostrated flexibility) and the receptionist wasn't that welcoming. I wasn't enthralled by the rooms decor/style and we needed our earplugs for the really noisy cicadas (if there are people in the courtyard corridor you can hear them as well.
reviews.title: Not A Good Experience

reviews.text: Enjoyed the breakfast and wbeing able alking to the fantastic pizza restaurant and posh food but snooty staffed Reubens the other night was great.
reviews.title: Pleasant

likes.liked: — near to restaurants and shopping,beatiful views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just a few tips if you are thinking of staying here:
reviews.title: Very friendly staff!

likes.liked: — The staff - they got out of their way to accommodate us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cleanliness: Shower dirty. Carpet needs renewing as it has that dirty feel. Clean sheets though!
reviews.title: We thought it was very good!

description: The 4-Star Protea Hotel Franschhoek, which overlooks the majestic mountains and vineyards of the historic village of Franschhoek, some 80 km east of Cape Town, prides itself on its charming ambiance, gracious style and attentive service. Indeed, if you are seeking a hotel which exudes tranquility and beauty, look no further than the Protea Hotel Franschhoek. With so much to do in this quaint town, Protea Hotel Franschhoek provides the perfect base for your holiday. With a renowned restaurant, conference facilities, luxury accommodation, a sparkling swimming pool and, being in the heart of wine country, a well-stocked vinotique; coming home is always a pleasure. Take advantage of our convenient location and explore Franschhoek's wide array of culinary establishments, art galleries, cheese factories and some 25 world famous wine estates. Franschhoek is one of South Africa's leading culinary and wine-tasting destinations. Various outdoor activities, such as horse-riding, golf, backpacking and trout-fishing, can also be arranged. The luxurious accommodation offered by the 4-Star Protea Hotel Franschhoek is a welcoming retreat at the end of a long day spent exploring this splendid town.
